items.summary: Remove external API dependencies from Store page (frontend/src/pages/Store.tsx) and replace useGetExternalSportsProducts hook with local mock data containing realistic sports products across categories: gym equipment (dumbbells, barbells, resistance bands, kettlebells), running gear (running shoes, GPS watches, hydration packs), sports apparel (workout shirts, shorts, leggings, jackets), and supplements (protein powder, pre-workout, BCAAs, vitamins). Each mock product should include: id, name, description, price, imageUrl (placeholder or stock image URL), category, and externalProductUrl fields.

Add a search input field at the top of the Store page (frontend/src/pages/Store.tsx) that allows users to filter displayed products by name or description in real-time. Implement client-side search filtering that updates the visible products as the user types, with debouncing (300ms delay) to improve performance. The search should work seamlessly with existing category and price filters.

Remove external API dependencies from FiTube page (frontend/src/pages/FiTube.tsx) and replace useGetExternalFitnessVideos hook with local mock data containing realistic fitness videos across categories: workout tutorials (strength training, HIIT, yoga, pilates), running tips (form analysis, training plans, injury prevention), nutrition advice (meal prep, supplement guides), and sports performance (technique breakdowns, drills). Each mock video should include: id, title, description, thumbnailUrl (placeholder or stock thumbnail), videoUrl or embedUrl, uploader/channel name, view count, and duration fields.

Update useGetExternalSportsProducts hook (frontend/src/hooks/useGetExternalSportsProducts.ts) to return mock data instead of making API calls. The hook should maintain the same TypeScript interface and return type but serve local mock data immediately without network requests. Include a comment explaining that this is mock data for demonstration purposes.

Update useGetExternalFitnessVideos hook (frontend/src/hooks/useGetExternalFitnessVideos.ts) to return mock data instead of making API calls. The hook should maintain the same TypeScript interface and return type but serve local mock data immediately without network requests. Include a comment explaining that this is mock data for demonstration purposes.
